title: What happened to Italian territories in Africa after WW2? - Quora

response.answer_text: The territories were Libya, Somalia, Ethiopia and Eritrea. They all became independent countries. Somalia however followed suit later, getting independence only in 1960. Between 1950 and 1960 Somalia was an Italian trusteeship, by task from the UN. Incidentally, as defeated country in WWII, Italy was admitted in the UN only in 1955. The trusteeship on Somalia had been a sort of homework the UN had given Italy (a non member state) to show its good will to rejoin the international community.
